p: One inoculated pig from each group was necropsied at 3â€…dpi, and hematoxylin and eosin (HE) and immunohistochemical (IHC) staining of lung tissues was conducted. Microscopic observations of pulmonary sections revealed that swine infected with JX346 had obvious alveolitis and lesions in the lung tissue, including infiltration of inflammatory cells, widened alveolar walls, and degenerate and intact neutrophils within the alveolar lumen ( Figure 2(C)). Swine infected with GD-E1 showed slight pathological changes in the lung tissue compared to the JX346 group; no severe tissue lesions were observed except for infiltration of inflammatory cells ( Figure 2(B)). The IHC staining results revealed a large amount viral nucleoprotein (NP) in the JX346 group ( Figure 2(F)), while no obviously viral protein was observed in the GD-E1 group ( Figure 2(E)).
